note.p: Career: Commissioned as an Ensign, 1st Foot Gurads, (17930; Lieutenant and Captain (1794); served as assistant to William Drummond, Envoy to Naples; retired 1798. Admitted to Lincoln's Inn, called to Bar 1803; Member of Parliament for Shrewsbury 1806-7 and 1811-26.
Freemason, initiated 25 May 1818, Union Lodge of Ionic and Prudence No 16 subsequently Royal Alpha Lodge No 16 London
Under a cloud for a possible homosexual incident, which ruined his reputation.
'Freemasons and the Royal Society; Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who are Masons' The Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 2010 page 9
